message.content:
Below is one systematic way to replicate exactly what is shown in the Target Image using the Dictionary blocks (without re‐orienting them beyond what is pictured).  The final build uses a total of 10 blocks arranged into two separate “towers.”

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
1)  DETAILED DESCRIPTION OF THE TARGET IMAGE
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

•  Overall there are two separate structures:

  LEFT STRUCTURE (4 blocks total):
   –  Top & Bottom:  Two identical red “arch” pieces stacked vertically to form a circular hole in the center.  
   –  Middle:  A green horizontal block runs across the hole.  
   –  Center:  A blue cube sits in the middle of that hole (embedded in line with the green block).  
   Visually it looks like a red rectangular prism with a cylindrical opening through which the green and blue blocks pass.

  RIGHT STRUCTURE (6 blocks total):
   –  Bottom Layer:  A tall green rectangular post standing upright.  
   –  Second Layer:  A wide yellow rectangular beam laid horizontally on top of the green post.  
   –  Third Layer:  A red arch block centered on the yellow beam (arch facing forward).  
   –  Fourth Layer:  A red rectangular block on top of the arch (from the front it appears solid red).  
   –  Roof Layer:  Two orange triangular blocks meeting at the peak, forming a “roof” shape.

•  Layer Counts:
   –  Left structure has 3 “horizontal” layers (top arch / middle band / bottom arch).  
   –  Right structure effectively has 5 layers (green column / yellow beam / red arch / red rectangle / orange roof pair).

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
2)  SELECTING THE REQUIRED BLOCKS & THEIR INDICES
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

Below are the exact Dictionary indices that match the shape, color, and **orientation** needed:

LEFT STRUCTURE (4 blocks):
 • Red “side‐arch” block (index 4), used twice  
 • Green short rectangular block (index 7)  
 • Blue cube (index 5)

RIGHT STRUCTURE (6 blocks):
 • Tall green rectangular block (index 8)  
 • Wide yellow horizontal block (index 12)  
 • Red arch block facing front (index 1)  
 • Red rectangular block with side arch (index 2) – from the front it appears rectangular  
 • Two orange triangular “roof” wedges (indices 14 and 15)

Note that we are reusing index 4 twice on the left, and that the same block index may appear multiple times in one build.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
3)  STEP-BY-STEP ASSEMBLY INSTRUCTIONS
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

{
  Step1:  Move block with index 4    (Place the bottom red arch for the left structure)
  Step2:  Move block with index 7    (Lay the green horizontal block across that arch)
  Step3:  Move block with index 5    (Insert the blue cube into the center hole)
  Step4:  Move block with index 4    (Stack the second red arch block on top, completing the left structure)

  Step5:  Move block with index 8    (Stand the tall green post for the right structure)
  Step6:  Move block with index 12   (Lay the yellow beam on top of the green post)
  Step7:  Move block with index 1    (Center the red arch on the yellow beam)
  Step8:  Move block with index 2    (Place the red rectangular block on top of the arch)
  Step9:  Move block with index 14   (Attach the first orange roof piece)
  Step10: Move block with index 15   (Attach the second orange roof piece to complete the roof)
}

Following these steps yields the two‐part arrangement exactly as in the Target Image.
